txt.en: 'Hold, Elendil.'
'I mean no disrespect.'
'Glorfindel has always spoken highly of your wisdom, Lendelen.'
'I relent in this. They will stay.'
'No. Only barely did I survive the two.'
'With three, even the mightiest of my people, long gone from this world, could only succumb.'
'The fires of Sauron's thoughts burn hotter than dragons' flame, and he would overmaster me.'
'I would become his servant, and slaughter you all.'
'We cannot use the rings.'
Talk to Vëamacil
'There is a way.'
'This war of yours has gone on for too long. My people grow bored.'
Observe the council of the kings
'Perhaps it is different for your kind. But my kind takes to wandering.'
'In my wanderings I found a hollow place in the rocks.'
'A tunnel was there concealed. It bent southward to the tower.'
Talk to High King Elendil
'Leave or stay, it makes no difference to me!'
'Walls once blocked the passage, but they have fallen into disrepair.'
'I have seen the size of that horde, and I cannot see how we might defeat it!'
'I can show you the entrance.'
'Why would he? He is a coward.'
'I will go no further, but I can take you there.'
'He will wait behind his walls until the horde soaks the dust with our blood.'
High King Gil-galad has called into question your presence, and that of the sons of Isildur, at the council of kings.
'And then he will revel in our end.'
Vëamacil is in the tent where the council of kings is underway.
The council of kings is underway.
'My king, it is true that this tent is crowded.'
'But we meet to discuss what might be done to change our fortunes in this war.'
Talk to High King Gil-galad
Lendelen of the Bright Company has proposed a dangerous plan by which Sauron's hold over the Ghâzab Bôron might be broken.
'Any of us might provide the spark to inspire our future course.'
'If we cannot lure him out, perhaps we can do him harm from within.'
Observe the council of the kings
'This horde that draws near, this Storm of Wrath...'
'No Easterling lord has the strength or the will to hold such a throng together.'
Talk to Vëamacil
'Not even the greatest kings of old could do so.'
'But Sauron can... because he holds an Oath-stone.'
Observe the council of the kings
'Stay thy rebuke.'
The council of the kings continues, but not all in attendance are satisfied with its pronouncements.

'You will fight alongside the Bright Company for this undertaking, [placeholder], if that is the wish of Glorfindel and his counsellor Lendelen. It will be dangerous, but what matters of war are not? If they are Men, my grandsons will forgive you for being so-selected, and resent it not.\n\n'If the Bright Company fails in this, the Storm of Wrath will come for us all, and they will then have ample opportunity to die in glorious battle. If that is a comfort to them, let it comfort them. I will coddle them not.'
With the triumphant Rhúnhoth horde of the Ghâzab Bôron on its way, the lords of the Great Alliance have called a council to determine what can be done to stave off defeat.
High King Elendil is inside the pavilion for the council of kings.
'I cannot believe this!'

#-1:[placeholder]'This pavilion seems more crowded already than it need be for such a council. Is it not better to limit those in attendance? I mean no disrespect to the sons of Isildur or their sire, but what is to be gained by their presence here, or that of a wild-#-1:{woman[f]|man}? Can they, and you, not be told the decisions of this council once they are made?'

'You will fight alongside the Bright Company for this undertaking, if that is the wish of Glorfindel and his counsellor Lendelen. It will be dangerous, but what matters of war are not? If they are Men, my grandsons will forgive you for being so-selected, and resent it not.\n\n'If the Bright Company fails in this, the Storm of Wrath will come for us all, and they will then have ample opportunity to die in glorious battle. If that is a comfort to them, let it comfort them. I will coddle them not.'
'Keep your head high, friend. They will have no choice but to keep us in attendance.'

'Let us enter the tent, but do not walk with fear or nervousness! Stride, rather, as if we were invited and indeed the council cannot begin until we are in attendance.\n\n'That is always the advice of Vëamacil, and to speak truth I have yet to see it fail him.'
'Did we miss anything?'
'Leaders of the Great Alliance...'
'Círdan. And the other is Elrond.'
'If we are to win this war, we must defeat Sauron.'
'And we must do it before the horde arrives.'
'Our time grows short. We must break the Dark Tower.'
'Send to Galadriel for the third ring.'
'Perhaps, with all three...'
'This is folly. You must see it.'

'This pavilion seems more crowded already than it need be for such a council. Is it not better to limit those in attendance? I mean no disrespect to the sons of Isildur or their sire, but what is to be gained by their presence here, or that of a [placeholder]? Can they, and you, not be told the decisions of this council once they are made?'
'How long have you been listening to our council?'
'He would keep the stone close by, in the highest chambers of Barad-dûr.'
'How would you reach it? How would you even enter the tower?'

'Durin is right. Sauron will hide in his tower until the Rhúnhoth horde arrives and destroys us! Why would he dare come out when his victory is all but assured? He has only to wait for it!\n\n'We have to think of something!'
'It is.'
'No, my sons. This mission is not for you.'
'And if my grandsons have any sense, they will still their tongues.'
'Leave the High Elves to their work.'
'This is our opportunity! Now is our chance for glory!'
'I will go. I have weathered much because of Sauron's deeds.'
'I will bring him challenge, and see if he comes forth.'
'The Orcs will need a reason to come out.'
'A good reason.'
'You will need to explain yourself, my friend.'
'My friend...'
'You cannot do it alone.'
'Your blade might sing, but a throng of Orcs would feed the crows with you.'
'Even if somehow you survived, you could not reach the Vandassar without help.'
'You need not ask.'
'Truly? If you wish it to be so, Lendelen.'
'Bored? In time of war?'
'The Bright Company will see it done.'
'Is this plan to the satisfaction of Men, Elendil?'
Instance: The Council of Kings
Tárandil is outside the pavilion where the council of the kings will take place.
The council of the kings will soon begin, and the sons of Isildur are hopeful that their presence and yours will go unremarked.
High King Gil-galad has reservations about your attendance and that of Isildur's sons.
'I have broken the hold of a Vandassar before.'
'I can do it again.'
'No, they are waiting for the others to arrive.'
'If this tunnel leads where you say, it may enable me to reach the Oath-stone.'
'They do not look happy.'
'I know, old friend, but I cannot ask this of you.'
'That Elf leads the Bright Company, I think. I do not know the other.'
'And yet... I would ask for one other.'
'Gil-galad I know. Who are the other two, again?'
'This one, the guest of Isildur's foster-son.'
'I will fight alongside the Bright Company!'
'Tárandil?'
'What? How can this be?'
Follow Tárandil to the council
'As will I!'
'We cannot stay behind!'
'Durin is right.'
'The arrival of the Storm of Wrath will be the end of us.'
'Lure him out, then.'
'Even the wariest hound will bite, if the meat smells ripe enough.'
Talk to Tárandil
Wait for the council of the kings to begin
'I too will go!'
'We are not afraid!'
